Description: Terracotta figurine fragment: left foot, broken at top, hollow, wearing sandal, with broad strap across arch indicated in red paint, plastic thong between big toe and second toe. Part of second toe broken off. Orange-red clay with blackish core, white slip on outside.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ.(?) (likely)
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University of Pennsylvania Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology, Philadelphia. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

4th century BC (?) parallel in the Louvre, possibly from Marion, Cyprus (Fourrier & Queyrel 1998, 471-2, no.719 = MNB 763a MNB 763b). Egypt Exploration Fund distribution list Philadelphia no. 35. Unclear pencil mark on heel, possibly a Φ designating this comes from a context within the sanctuary of Aphrodite, from Gardner’s excavations in 1885-1886. Caubet, A., Queyrel, A. & Fourrier, S. 1998. 'L'art Des Modeleurs D'argile: Antiquités De Chypre, Coroplastique'. Musée du Louvre'. Paris.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DA.110) (Phase 1)
